intro: Dombeya ranofotsyensis, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. The leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
